cons: Dell's poor financial performance meant comparativly poor pay and conditions. In addition Dell is a US company with a "provincial" and largely US centric outlook.
pros: Dell people are some of the best in the world at what they do. It's just that people don't want what Dell traditionally sells anymore. Some company's can re invent them selves maybe Dell is one of those companies. Maybe not.

cons: I show the downsides of working following.But it has the advantage.Salary up is difficult.Chronic lack of resources.Uncertain career paths.
pros: I can in addition to hardware skill, learn software skill of wide.Then I can learn the know-how of technical support engineers.

cons: irregular shifts, do or die,
advice: Selling is not everything
pros: cafeteria, decent pay, and good atmosphere

cons: dnt know what is going to happen in next minutegiven up providing employee benifits like marraige bonus ...
advice: wost management
pros: time is flexible and 9 hrs working time

cons: Management was less than knowledgeable about the specifics of our job, and were quick to provide unnecessary metrics that you needed to hit in order to be "performing to the standard."
advice: Get more involved with providing feedback to workers, learn the job that they have to do!
pros: Good pay, at least in the position I was in. Management is nice.Not tough to get time off, and give you the option of working from home, so you can make your own hours most of the time.
summary: Not a bad place, but I had trouble getting solid feedback about my performance, and management was not familiar with job

cons: Gigantic bureaucratic mess. Too many processes & procedures to follow which do nothing other than cause huge delays and simply destroys morale and makes customers mad.
advice: Stop letting sales run the show.
pros: Salary, benefits are good. Numerous resources to reach out to for help. Most people are willing to help when you track them down.

cons: Not a great work culture, Again it depends on your Manager and senior Manager.May not be a great place to work for long term.
advice: Need to start caring attutude to employee sAlso start considering the requirements of new employee s, Not only old.
pros: Good Brand valueWorld class culture.Salary s are great, not badCareer could get stagnated. Over all good, not great.

cons: Management is not trained and lack knowledge and leadership skillsChained to your deskGrowth is hard and promotions are simply who you are friends withEmployee training outside of onboarding is lacking
advice: Offer leadership training to managmentMore focus on staff development is neededStaff should be viewed as assets and not as replaceable
pros: Easy jobYou won't get fired easilySpiffs and freebies are goodStaff is friendly and youngA good entry job

cons: Internal systems make data management tedious, little to no cohesion across teams, constant reorgs and changes to job descriptions, expectations for roles change frequently and can sometimes be obtuse.
advice: Fix your internal systems to align with management goals before executing on those goals. Make up your mind on the company's structure. Regionalize.
pros: Progressive work from home policies, flexible hours for those in the right role, good salaries, friendly cooworkers, good deals on hardware once in a while

cons: Very Limited growth opportunity as at Dell India R&D center only work is in storage domain.If you are a Developer than this company is not for you at all.For Developers here in Dell India R&Donly third class maintenance work is here.Only work is there on Application side ,People here in even don't heard of system Programming.Good for tester to join this companyNo onsite opp… ortunity at all.Just testing and bug fixing work is here .You won't enhance your technical skills in DellIn last ,Its named as Dell India R&D center and people see it as big brand but you come here (specially developers) and work ,then only you come to know This R&D is just for name sake ,here therr is no Development work ,research is too-2 far.
pros: No work pressure becoz there is no work to challenge you.Flexible working timings ,people used to come at 11 am and go home 6 pm ,Again becozof lack of work.Good pay if u r Dell Employee.

cons: it is not very employee centric
advice: think about the employees also...
pros: the work environment was awesome

cons: Partial attitude of senior management
pros: Good job opportunities & growth prospect.

cons: NO personal life in Dell
pros: Values your work and awards you accordingly

cons: sale pressure is high and products are very downs
pros: supporting TM are good one and supporting
summary: Good but lot of sale pressure

cons: opportunity and career growth etc.....
advice: nothing
pros: brand name and popularity etc....

cons: To adapt to market strategy and also survey the pay price in the market.Faster movement inside the system, reduce the duration of months to move between depts.
advice: Pay well
pros: Its a amazing brandLike the work cultureAmazing growth opportunitiesFocus is on expanding customer service and acquisition, which gives grater scope to move to different depts to gain exp.

cons: work conditions add on a lot of stress at times
advice: tone down on achievable targets
pros: polishes an individual without much ado

cons: Work load is too much over time is encouraged without overtime payment sometimes.
advice: Management can heir more people to reduce work load.
pros: Dell has a good working environment and good work culture.

cons: Work Life Balance is sometimes hard to maintain especially if one is in the Engineering line
advice: I think the Management is doing a fantastic job of positioning the company in the market and making use of global opportunities to boost sales and increase revenue/profits
pros: Great Work CultureFreedom to innovate and experiment with new ways of doing things

cons: Less employee focusTransparencyTalent retention
advice: Focus on talent without prejudice
pros: New technologiesWork life balanceFlexi time

cons: Lacks good projects in SAP
pros: Compensation is good and reputation of company is tremendous..

cons: Compensation and benifits not to the expected levels.
pros: Work pressure prepares you for any challenge one might face in the future.

cons: odd working hours and broken pool table
pros: Good career growth and overall development

cons: 2nd level management and up don't care about employee careersno trainingno promotions1st level managers have no control on dept budgets1st level managers have minimum control on performance rewards
advice: trust your 1st level management, give them more freedom to decide what to do, how to do it
pros: global companycultural diversityup to date technology

cons: growth is not possiblefixed income untill 2-3 yearsshift timings are badsenior management is corruptpolitics is too muchgrowth is neglible
advice: none
pros: stability is therenice start for freshersinternational valuesalary for start is goodwork enviornment is good

cons: - If your not based in one of the main support hubs, career progression can be extremely limited as there isn't that much of an opportunity to develop- for those going out of their way for the business and assisting the business in various needs is not rewarded and instead criticized- For the type of work, too much emphasis on metric based results rather than letting staff do what is required to get the issue…  resolved
advice: The direction dell is taking now is right for how we need to evolve as a business, however this isn't being taking into consideration from a lower management perspective as they are looking to operate on basic targets with lack of understanding of the movement the business is undertaking
pros: - Professional Working environment- A Good start for those looking to get into Enterprise level infrastructure (from a hardware basis, Server/Networking/Storage)- Good resources to hand to assist employees improve knowledge if they are looking towards industry certificates- focuses a lot on the customer, what concerns they have and addresses them- There's a strong movement within the business to move … away from Hardware support only to a services support structure- Benifits and compensation reasonable if nothing else

cons: All the good work and thought leadership is not percolating down to team member level, Managers are impervious.Zero Job rotation in healthcare,If one wants and has the opportunity to move internally, one does not get support,at last one has to move to other company for growth / new projects.
advice: Leaders should meet team members ,may be in a small group. All hands and Town Halls are not sufficient to get the pulse of People.
pros: Employee Friendly HR Policy,New HR is taking things in a positive way.Goodleadership.
summary: Dell Services, Healthcare Vertical , Whitefield , Bangalore

cons: A little bureaucracy and boring leaders. You cant look upto some of them. Monotonous action plans...
advice: Get rid of those little bureaucracy...
pros: Manufacturing, Services - All in one! Huge opportunity to learn.
summary: A place which gives peace of mind, fat pay checks and opportunity to grab branch out knowledge

cons: Too many Mid-managerLack of resource
advice: define company vision without cost.
pros: Decision making is very speedy.Restricted Cost Control
summary: Sometimes best, sometimes worst.This is ordinary company.

cons: annual appraisal is less. Gives very less increment and appraisal cycle is not transparent.Some policies are not employ friendly .
pros: Dell has Good working culture and roles are defined. The grades are well defined.it is good for lateral hires as it provides good package to lateral hires.

cons: Work pressure is very high.
pros: Good work environment.Good package.Space to grow higher.
summary: Good Organization to be a part of.

cons: 1. Corporate level lacks of overall direction, stuck between PC and Enterprise Service.2. Lack of core competency, e.g. Innovation, design.3. Too frequent org changes have caused instability.4. Some managers are too short term focused on annual performance, no long term view.5. Poor product marketing and slow time to market6. Bureaucracy
advice: Focus and invest on corporate capability instead of short term financial goals
pros: 1. Org changes that offer opportunities for internal movement2. Procurement org is investing a lot in talent development3. Frequent internal communication from top management

cons: less salaryvery slow growth.
pros: nice work place.good work culture.would love to work here again but at higher grade
summary: Overall good experience and nice work culture, but, less salary

cons: --No OOTO message allowed on your inbox when traveling--SEs are required to find two other SEs to volunteer to provide coverage when taking PTO.--low paying job, yet was sold as a six figure job--billed as 25% travel though travel has averaged 38% and at times can be much higher.--Opinions are not valued by upper management. Middle management likes to rule with an iron fist.
advice: The Sales Engineers work in tandem with the RSMs but are not treated as equals. SEs do not get to go to President's Club, are among the lowest paid SEs in the technology industry, cannot take sick days because there is no system in place for coverage, and the RSMs (Regional Sales Managers) get paid 2-3 times as much as the SE does.
pros: --Exciting technology--Strong brand name--Great customer base
summary: Wyse--the right choice for salespeople, but not for Sales Engineers.

cons: Low salaries and stock options are underwater
pros: Able to work from home, nice people and benefits

cons: Directionless Senior management, Short term benefit based decision making, Disconnected executive team and employees. Super rich ex. wiproite senior management seems to be more concerned about their own welfare than Dell Services or regular employees interest.m No new accounts or business wins for a long time is affecting the employee morale.
advice: Most of the cost saving measures and impacting the lower level employees while senior management and ELT members continue to enjoy. A lot ot ELT members don't have any experience in Services business. All those senior Ex.Wiproites (expelled by Premji) who joined Dell services seems to be bent upon trying their failed wipro strategies here again. No new business or accounts for the last 2 years. Need to treat employee… s as assets than liabilities. Dell's internal IT team is a huge cost and has zero experience and are arrogant while dealing with other customers. Having them over experienced services professionals is a huge mistake.
pros: Big brand, hard working engineers.
summary: Future does not look very bright here.

cons: Politics galore. One needs to take efforts to stay clear of it.
advice: 'Tell Dell' should be totally confidential unlike what happens in reality
pros: Systems were in place. Quite professional
summary: Dell can be hell based on how one views challenges, as obstacles or opportunities.

cons: Employee satisfaction is not up to mark, attrition is increasing on a high note. Growth is very less.
pros: It helps in grooming your career if you are looking forward for a good technical training and first hand work experience, then Dell is a good company to work with.
summary: Good company to work with, yet hard to sustain

cons: intense culture, zero sum game
pros: Opportunities to work in different departments

cons: No growth opportunities, high pressure environment, can get frustrating for the amount of process and procedures it can take to get your work done
pros: Good for entry level profiles, ethical workplace (for the most part), process oriented, fun filled work environment for the most part with opportunities to learn

cons: Less learning , Bad implementation of software dev life cycle, less developers and more legacy systems and less hikes. Sticking to project dead lines is impossible
advice: Hyderabad Dell IT mngmt should be fixed
pros: Great atmosphere and facilities . Flexible work culture. Gym , cafetaria, ground for cricket , badmintion courts , no restricted timings , work from home facility . Cultural activities and competitions makes life very enjoyable
summary: Not for computer science graduates from reputed schools

cons: No defined career path. Networking is key to get promoted and the more executives you know, then you get promoted faster. Introverts don't have an opportunity to shine as opinions are formed pretty quickly by some managers and that's difficult to change.
advice: Reevaluate the calibration structure.
pros: Very dynamic work environment. Things are changing so fast that you learn something new all the time. The people I work with are fantastic and the work life balance is great.
summary: Be ready to execute & deliver on day 1

cons: Changes and addition to work a way to frequent, to undetstand.
pros: Dell values your efforts at work amidst the challenges thrown at you.
summary: Good place to launch yourself to the next level.

cons: Cost cutting is dampening spirit and there are too many execs who can;t adapt and focus too much on the past sucesses.
advice: Get new blood and people who are really able to take risks and build high quality solutions rather than go small and cheap.
pros: Great community spirit, lots of smart people
summary: Challenging Times with too many senior execs unable to adapt

cons: You may have heard that people dont quit companies, but people....
advice: Practice the method followed uniformly globally...and it will be a success...
pros: I simply love Dell..coz I worked there for a long period and would have never have quit it, given an opportunity. I Love the organisational structure and the progress.

cons: Invaded by Wipro resources. Exodus of SME at all levels
pros: Large customer base. Ability to cross sell services. Around the globe presence. Has the quest to be top 3 in IT & BPO Services
summary: Interesting place to work for Healthcare

cons: Screwed up work life balance.You don't have to worry about deadlines as they keep on changing.Management is very US centric and all the decisions are driven from the US.The management team in India does not have much say in the strategic decision making process.
advice: Look at long term goals and plans and stop looking at Quarter to Quarter results
pros: Good benefits and salary.Listen to employees and have a good 360 feedback mechanism.
summary: Changes are the order of the day

cons: budgets cut to the bone, strategy changes weekly, struggling to innovate in the virtualization space.
advice: not certain they would listen
pros: Benefits, PTO, people, work life balance
summary: Iif you have a passion to innovate look elsewhere

cons: make 150-200 calls a daylow salary till promoted
advice: pay more with compensation
pros: relaxed environmentgreat supervisorsget to watch tvgood opportunitygood time off
summary: good opportunity to make money once you move up, but getting there is the hard part

cons: The company is trying to be both CDW and IBM at the same timeShifting too many jobs to PanamaToo many overlapping products
advice: Although the hearts in the right place regardign shifting the company for strategic growth Dell continues to market only the consumer segment of the business. Everyone knows Dell makes PCs. Let the world know what some of the other capabilities are. Take a page of IBM's marketing playbook.
pros: Outstanding portfolio of products and servicesVery good leadership teamMaking strategic acquisitions

cons: poor salarytransport for employees suck
pros: fun and challenging jobmedical benefits

cons: Stability in terms of go to market strategies

cons: - Importance to only Box selling, if you have are good in sales its one of the best places to work.- Beware job profile lies during interview process- Huge salary disparity at same level- Treat you like outsider during the notice period

pros: - Any company can be judged by its people, its a good company to work for if you are looking for like minded friends, diversity and culture- Competitive salary with market among its peers

cons: sales policies among the divisions are not homogeneous
advice: sales policies among the divisions should be homogeneous
pros: learn more about cleint and enterprise technology

cons: salary structure is poor for freshers
advice: try to retain existing talent
pros: training was good at dell

cons: Not much growth since it is a captive.Shift is from the noon onwards. Can't have too many plans for the evening. Not really much to do on the social life front even if the mornings are free.
pros: Good work life balance and relaxed pace.Exposure to some global practices.Good brand name especially in the international scene.

cons: Company meritocracy. Some people in your department do not get a raise or bonus.
advice: Company went overseas. Beware a lot of empty promises.
pros: Great benefits. A lot of overtime to add to your base salary.

cons: Work life balance is very poor. Too many late night meetings everyday. Average Senior management. Poor program management . No clearly defined roles.
advice: Improve work life balance and compensations at non-us locations
pros: Great place to learn technology. Tremendous opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and learn how the largest ecommerce experience is built and managed.
summary: Great place to work. But no one hear has heard of work life balance

cons: The so-called meritocracy is not valuable assessment of employee value. Employees are ranked by managers, more in the manner of popularity and not in the value of contributions.Company blames the rank and file on its inability to execute to strategy.
advice: Take ownership of executing to strategy.
pros: Great compensation - Dell has very good salaries, bonuses and incentives. There is often a great project to which you can contribute.

cons: However, career progression is pretty hard, no real mentoring, defined career progression, also salary and benefits aren't really up to the market for the similar size of company.
advice: Tell Dell a lot times doesn't tell....
pros: The work life balance is good here, and people are generally nice and friendly. There are lots of charity activities year round as well if you are a community person.
summary: Good work life balance, Com&Ben isn't up to the market though
